results.title: A Little something about us
results.creator_credit: School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne and Sze Ching Lee
results.brief_description: Interviews with several young women from diverse Asian backgrounds who, through pixellated images, share their aspirations, interests, and love-hate relationships with Mellbourne, the city that has adopted them.

results.title: Landholder Group Participation: a Model for Action
results.creator_credit: Peter Mountjoy and Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group
results.brief_description: Shows the process of landholders realising that the problems of salinity and erosion need to be tackled in groups rather than as individuals. Illustrates the establishment of the Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group. Shows the group working with Agriculture Extension Officers and Soil Conservation personnel, owning their involvement and taking responsibility for their actions. Useful as a model for people planning to establish community action groups.

results.title: Using a computer catalogue
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jenny Craig, Keith Rees, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.

results.title: Adventure Games in the Classroom
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Outlines how to integrate the computer into the classroom by using an adventure games approach. The emphasis is on situations where only one computer per class is available.

results.title: Communication without speech
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Recent advances in technology have enabled the development of a range of sophisticated communication devices which, with the assistance of microprocessors, enables students with severe communication impairment to communicate, using voice and print.

results.title: Punching keys
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A biting dramatisation of the effects of the new technology in deskilling the female office workforce, alienating women from the products of their labour, and rendering them replaceable by cheaper labour overseas. Cast includes a young Gina Riley.

results.title: [The Tatler social newsreel]
results.brief_description: This film was one of the many documentaries shot in Victoria by Efftee Studios in the early 30s. In this newsreel compiled and narrated by Peter Newmarch of “The Truth” newspaper and shot by Bert Nicholas, several Melbourne socialites are featured at various functions: a social party in South Yarra, the first official meeting of the Centenary Dog Club at the Melbourne Showground and Ron Cameron’s Riding School. NOTE: No titles included.

results.title: Factory to farm
results.brief_description: Shows the various stages in the manufacture of farm implements and machinery and their use on Australian wheat farms during the 1920s. An important film on Australian history, both from farming and the “Sunshine Harvester Factory” points of view. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Shows the various stages in the manufacture of farm implements and machinery and their use on Australian wheat farms during the 1920s. results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.

results.title: The Minemaker
results.creator_credit: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.
